it.unimi.dsi.law.stat
Class KendallTau

java.lang.Object
  it.unimi.dsi.law.stat.KendallTau

public class KendallTau
extends Object

Computes Kendall's τ between two rankings.

Given two lists of doubles expressing two rankings for a list of items (higher ranks come first), this class provides static methods to compute efficiently Kendall's τ using an ExchangeCounter. It is also possible to require all comparison are limited to a given number of binary digits.

More precisely, given ri and si ( i = 1, 2, …, n ), we say that a pair (i, j) is

  • concordant iff ri − rj and si − sj are both non-zero and have the same sign;
  • discordant iff ri − rj and si − sj are both non-zero and have opposite signs;
  • an r-tie iff ri − rj = 0;
  • an s-tie iff si − sj = 0;
  • a joint tie iff ri − rj = 0 and si − sj = 0.

Let C, D, Tr, Ts, J be the number of concordant pairs, discordant pairs, r-ties, s-ties and joint ties, respectively, and N = n(n − 1)/2. Of course C+D+Tr+Ts − J = N. Kendall's τ is now

τ = (C − D) / [(N − Tr)(N − Ts)]1/2

A main method is provided for command-line usage.

Method Detail

compute

public static double compute(double[] v0,
                             double[] v1)
Computes Kendall's τ between two rankings.

Note that this method must be called with some care. More precisely, the two arguments should be built on-the-fly in the method call, and not stored in variables, as the first argument array will be null'd during the execution of this method to free some memory: if the array is refenced elsewhere the garbage collector will not be able to collect it.

Parameters:
v0 - the first ranking.
v1 - the second ranking.
Returns:
Kendall's τ.
